text: Thanks John for the reply. Unfortunately it's not what I need. This function returns the public URL of a specified template or code file. I have the biggest issue with custom fonts. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/use-fonts-in-HubSpot|As per HubSpot documentation> you should upload manually font files to: *Marketing* > *Files and Templates* > *Files*. And AFAIK there is no function that will return url to this location.
SInce files in production environment are public I could just use for dev purposes url to prod assets but it's suboptimal IMO.
include a font file in your theme and use the function instead. That documentation is wrong :wink:
well… “wrong” is a little harsh – those docs are more geared for content creators and not necessarily developers
